repository.corpname: Akkasah: Center for Photography (NYU Abu Dhabi)

did.unittitle: Travel in the Middle East Album

physdesc.extent: The album measures album 26 x 26 cm, each photograph around 7.7 x 10.5cm.
physdesc.physfacet: Photographs all in good condition, a few are missing. The album has damage to the spine but not to the binding.

did.abstract: An album of 130 images taken during a trip through Lebanon, Jordan and Syria in August 1966 by an ex-soldier who had previously worked on the Baghdad Railway. The album was compiled by Paul Fischer, who was a soldier in World War I, between 1916-1919 as an Eisenbahn-Pionier working on the Baghdad railway. After World War I he was a prisoner of war (Kriegsgefangener) in Turkey and had finished the railroad for the firm Holzmann, Frankfurt/Main. After this time and back in Germany, he married his wife Anna Leibing on the 1st October 1927, they lived in Penig. Later Fischer worked at the ""Adolf Oeser Maschinen-Fabrik"", in Leipzig, until 1940. Between 1941-1945 he worked in the ""Getriebewerk"" in Penig. He died in East Germany.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Text from the album seller: "The name of the person was Paul Fischer. He was a soldier in World War I. From 1916-1919 as Eisenbahn-Pionier. In this time he worked at the railroad of the Bagdad-railroad. After World War I he was a prisoner of war (Kriegsgefangener) in Türkei and had finished the railroad for the firm Holzmann, Frankfurt/Main. After this time and back in Germany he married his wife in 1.10.1927. Her name war Anna, borned as Liebing (Mädchenname, the name before they married). He lived in Penig (saxonia in Germany). Later he worked at the "Adolf Oeser Maschinen-Fabrik", in Leipzig, until 1940. The years 1941-1945 he worked in the "Getriebewerk" in Penig. He died in East Germany."

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Collection was processed in order that it was recieved

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: NYU Abu Dhabi holds all copyright and related rights pertaining to this collection. Please contact Akkasah at akkasah@nyu.edu for information regarding information and use.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Album: Travels in the Middle East; AD_MC_042; box number; folder number or item identifier; Akkasah Center for Photography, New York University.

did.unittitle: The front cover of the album 'Travel in the Middle East.'
The inside front cover of the album 'Travel in the Middle East.'
Portraits of two men standing in front of a Middle East Airlines, Air Liban plane.
From the top down: One Lebanese pound note, two views of mountains, and two views of buildings in Lebanon.

From the top left clockwise: A group portrait of several boys, a man standing next to an automobile, two boys facing away from the camera with a group of men and children sitting with sheep in the background, and a street scene in which man holds a bottle up in the foreground (linked ref6).
Left: a boy standing near an automobile, two men ride horses in the background. Right: a portrait of a man sitting next to a cactus (linked ref5).
A portrait of a man wearing a head covering.
From the top left clockwise: Views of the Beiteddine Palace including a fountain in the courtyard, an interior, and an interior with inlay decorations.
Top: A sword encased in glass. Bottom: A fountain in Beiteddine Palace.
Views of ruins in Baalbek, Lebanon.
Views of columns in Baalbek, Lebanon.
From the top left clockwise: two columns, a facade of a building, three men sitting outdoors, one plays an instrument, and a domed building.
Three views of architectural details and one view of a row of columns in Baalbek, Lebanon.
Portraits of men in Damascus, Syria.
Street views of Damascus, Syria, including portraits of a fruit vendor, children, and men.
From the top left clockwise: A portrait of a crying girl, a child, a boy selling food, and a view of the Basman Hotel.
Street scenes in Damascus, including views of Martyrs' Square and the Telegraph Monument.
From the top left clockwise: buildings in Damascus, a street scene, a group portrait of six men, and The Minaret of the Bride (Madhanat al-Arus) on the Umayyad Mosque.
Views of the Hamidiyah Souq, including a glass dealer, a fruit vendor, and a tram.
From the top left clockwise: one view of the Hamidiyah Souq, and views of other markets in Damascus.
From the top left clockwise: two street views, and two views of the Hamidiyah Souq, Damascus.
Portraits of groups in a market, Damascus.
From the top left clockwise: a group of men in a butcher's shop, street scenes and people walking in front of Basman Hotel in Damascus.
From the top left clockwise: street vendors and people in a market, a crowd in the market, the Umayyad Mosque, and a mosque in Damascus.

From the top left clockwise: buildings and a minaret, an altar in the Church of Saint Catherine, a statue in the Church of Saint Catherine's courtyard, and a man walking in the street in front of Bab Kisan.
Left: A aerial view of people and cars in the street next to the Basman Hotel. Right: A man standing next to a road.
From the top left clockwise: an encampment in the desert, a portrait of a boy in front of a terraced city, and two views of camels in the desert, Jordan.
Views of rocky landscapes, mountains, and a camel caravan in the desert, Jordan.
Camels and donkeys in the desert, Jordan.
A view of three structures in the desert, and three views of buildings on hillsides.
From the top left clockwise: the Dome of the Rock, the Al-Aqsa Mosque, a cave, and a portrait of two boys on the road near a city in Jordan.
From the top left clockwise: a hotel lobby desk, tents in the desert, a boy running on the road, and a portrait of a man standing against a wall.
From the top left clockwise: a man in front of a rock formation with rock-cut tombs; people in front of the Golden Gate, Jerusalem; and a man posing in front of the River Jordan.
A portrait of a man standing in a body of water.
Top: an olive tree in the Garden of Gethsemane. Bottom: two views of the outside wall of the Church of the Nativity, Bethlehem.
A blank page in the album 'Travel in the Middle East.'
Top: a view of the 'Abisko Stockholm.' Bottom: a ship.
Portraits of men and women in a kitchen (linked ref40, ref41, ref42).
A blank page in the album 'Travel in the Middle East.'
Clockwise from bottom-left: two portraits of the same man, a man sitting outdoors, a portrait of two people kissing (linked ref38, ref41, ref42).
Two portraits of the same man (linked ref38, ref40, ref42).
Two portraits of the same man (linked ref38, ref40, ref41).
A portrait of a woman sitting on an armchair (linked ref38).
A blank page in the album 'Travel in the Middle East.'
The inside back cover of the album 'Travel in the Middle East.'
The back cover of the album 'Travel in the Middle East.'
